River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to this hybrid between science fiction and thriller.
Overall the film covers: cross-cultural war against indigenous tribes by European colonists; racial prejudice; sex tourism; women in conflict management; honour killings and balance of power struggles by fanatical military factions. Overlaid on this political "crime-saga"

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) and ultimately winds up on some planet where she risks her life to save people from all sorts of one dimensional threats. Very similar storylines in both cases.
But nevertheless, though this movie was amazingly bad, I liked it.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen creature from thousands and thousands of years ago. While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa falls off a building trying to prove his super-sized ego. Meanwhile, Tom picks up stray kittens from around town so he can cash in on government food subsidies for cut developmentally disabled children.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me Strawberry Fields Forever and A Day in the Life by The Beatles.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
